distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
An update for httpd and mod_http2 is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.0 Extended Update Support.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The httpd packages provide the Apache HTTP Server, a powerful, efficient, and extensible web server.

Security Fix(es):

* httpd: HTTP request splitting with mod_rewrite and mod_proxy (CVE-2023-25690)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of CRLF Sequences in HTTP Headers ('HTTP Request/Response Splitting')

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in httpd. This security issue occurs when some mod_proxy configurations on Apache HTTP Server allow an HTTP Request Smuggling attack. Configurations are affected when mod_proxy is enabled along with some form of RewriteRule or ProxyPassMatch in which a non-specific pattern matches some portion of the user-supplied request-target (URL) data and is then re-inserted into the proxied request-target using variable substitution.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: httpd: HTTP request splitting with mod_rewrite and mod_proxy
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the updated packages, the httpd daemon will be restarted automatically.

vulnerabilities.title: httpd: HTTP request splitting with mod_rewrite and mod_proxy
